Appearance.Color: Blonde and golden to deep golden-copper
Appearance.Head: White to off-white, fizzy to creamy and delicate to generally lasting

Aroma-and-taste.Malts: Generally bready and sweet, leaning biscuity in Kölsch and Blonde, to caramel in ESB
Aroma-and-taste.Hops: Low to moderate aroma and flavor of Noble hop variety in Kölsch and any variety in Blonde, and earthy English hop character in ESB
Aroma-and-taste.Yeast: Fruity esters generally low in Kölsch, moderate in Blonde and moderate to high in ESB

Mouth-feel.Consistency: Smooth, with a crispness to Kölsch and some Blondes

Kölsch.Popular_Examples: Gaffel Kölsch, Reissdorf Kölsch, Flying Dog Tire Bite Golden Ale, Ballast Point Pale Ale, Harpoon Summer Beer, Alaskan Summer Ale, Pyramid Curve Ball Blonde Ale, Stoudts Karnival Kölsch, New Holland Full Circle
Kölsch.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: Brick, Brie, Camembert, Edam, Monterey Jack
Kölsch.Food_Pairing_Ideas: German dishes, salads, chicken dishes, grilled foods, fish, shellfish and spicy foods

Extra_Special_Bitter.Popular_Examples: Fuller’s ESB, Redhook ESB, Left Hand Sawtooth Ale, Anderson Valley Boont ESB, AleSmith Anvil Ale ESB, Yards Extra Special Ale, Shipyard Ringwood Old Thumper, SKA ESB Special Ale, Southern Tier Harvest Ale, Laughing Dog CSB
Extra_Special_Bitter.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: Asiago, Derby, Gouda, Havarti, Lancashire, Leicester
Extra_Special_Bitter.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Fish & chips, pork, roast chicken, lamb, barbecue, fried foods and pizza

American_Blonde_Ale.Popular_Examples: Pike Brewing Naughty Nellie Golden Ale, Scuttlebutt Homeport Blonde, Diamond Knot Blonde Ale, Great Divide Samurai Ale, Knee Deep Beautiful Blonde, Red Brick Blonde, Moylan’s Celts Golden Ale, St George Golden Ale, Ska True Blonde Ale, Blue Point Summer Ale, Fish Tale Organic Blonde Ale
American_Blonde_Ale.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: Brick, Edam, Monterey Jack, Pepper Jack
American_Blonde_Ale.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Italian dishes, salads, chicken dishes, grilled foods, fish, shellfish and spicy foods

Appearance.Color: Very Pale, from almost white, to brown
Appearance.Head: Fluffy, thick and long-lasting, leaving a lace on the glass

Aroma-and-taste.Malts: Sweet and biscuity to chocolaty and toasty in dark versions
Aroma-and-taste.Yeast: Fruity, with mild citrus to estery notes, including banana, with spicy flavor compounds, including clove in some styles

Weizenbock.Popular_Examples: Aventinus Wheat Doppel, Weihenstephaner Vitus, Schneider & Brooklyner Hopfen-Weisse, Ayinger Weizenbock, Victory Moonglow Weizenbock
Weizenbock.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Beef, roast pork, smoked ham, German-style dishes, desserts and chocolates

Witbier.Popular_Examples: Hoegaarden Original White Ale, St. Bernardus Witbier, Wittekerke, Allagash White Ale, Avery White Rascal, Ommegang Witte, Southampton Double White Ale, Unibroue Blanche de Chambly, Hitachino Nest White Ale, Clown Shoes Clementine White Ale
Witbier.Glassware: Pint or Nonic, Tumbler, Beer Mug
Witbier.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: Edam, Feta, Goat Cheese (Chèvre), Mascarpone, Mozzarella
Witbier.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Salads with light and vinaigrette dressings, light seafood dishes, mussels, sushi, lightly seasoned poultry and apple glazed pork

Hefeweizen.Popular_Examples: Weihenstephaner Hefe Weissbier, Spaten Franziskaner Hefe-Weiss, Paulaner Hefe Weissbier, Ayinger Bräu-Weisse, Schneider Weisse (Original), Hacker-Pschorr Weisse, Würzburger Julius Echter Hefe-Weissbier, Fürst Wallerstein Hefe-Weizen, Sierra Nevada Kellerweis Hefeweizen, Flying Dog In Heat Wheat
Hefeweizen.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Salads with fruity or vinaigrette dressings, German-style dishes, apple glazed pork and light seafood

Dunkelweizen.Popular_Examples: Franziskaner Hefe-Weisse Dark, Weihenstephaner Hefeweissbier Dark, Erdinger Weissbier Dunkel, Ayinger Ur-Weisse, Würzburger Julius Echter Hefe-Weiss-Dunkel, Hacker-Pschorr Dunkel Weisse
Dunkelweizen.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: Asiago, Colby, Goat Cheese (Chèvre), Gouda (including smoked)
Dunkelweizen.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Sausages, German dishes, roast chicken and pork

Berliner_Weissbier.Taste_Smell: Crisp, Tart, Fruity, Sour, Wheat, Light-bodied
Berliner_Weissbier.Popular_Examples: Fürst Wallerstein Weissbierpils, 1809 Berliner Style Wiess, Dogfish Head Festina Peche, The Bruery Hottenroth Berlinerweis
Berliner_Weissbier.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Salads with vinaigrette or blue cheese dressings

American_Pale_Wheat_Ale.Popular_Examples: Samuel Adams Coastal Wheat, Bell’s Oberon Ale, North Coast Blue Star Wheat, Anchor Summer Beer, Boulder Sweaty Betty Blonde, Big Sky Trout Slayer Ale, Samuel Adams Summer Ale, Southern Tier 422 Pale Wheat Ale, Leavenworth Whistling Pig Hefeweizen
American_Pale_Wheat_Ale.Glassware: Pint or Nonic, Beer Mug, Weizen Glass
American_Pale_Wheat_Ale.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Salads with fruity or lemony vinaigrette dressings, lemon-accented poultry and light seafood

Kristalweizen.Taste_Smell: Crisp, Fruity, Banana, Wheat, Light- Medium-bodied
Kristalweizen.Popular_Examples: Weihenstephaner Kristall Weissbier, Erdinger Weizen Kristall, Tucher Kristall Weizen
Kristalweizen.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Salads with fruity or vinaigrette dressings, German-style dishes and apple glazed pork

Appearance.Color: Deep golden to amber to copper
Appearance.Head: Generally white, creamy and lasting

Aroma-and-taste.Malts: Generally bready and sweet with caramel notes, and sometimes toasty
Aroma-and-taste.Hops: Earthy hop character in English styles; citrusy, piney hop character in American styles
Aroma-and-taste.Yeast: Fruity esters from the ale yeast strain

Mouth-feel.Consistency: Smooth and creamy, with American styles often crisp

Irish_Red_Ale.Popular_Examples: O’Hara’s Irish Red, Smithwick’s Irish Ale, Murphy’s Irish Red Beer, Samuel Adams Irish Red, Starr Hill Amber Ale, Karl Strauss Red Trolley Ale, Knee Deep Immigration Red Ale, Thomas Hooker Irish-Style Red Ale, Moylan’s Irish Style Red Ale, Thomas Creek River Falls Red Ale
Irish_Red_Ale.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Lamb, light fish dishes, French onion soup, roast beef and barbecue

American_Amber.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Burgers, barbecue, game, seafood, chicken, spicy dishes and pasta

Altbier.Popular_Examples: Uerige Altbier, Uerige DoppelSticke, Pinkus Organic Münster Alt, Alaskan Amber, Long Trail Ale, Otter Creek Copper Ale, Fordham Copperhead Ale, Leavenworth Eightmile Alt
Altbier.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: Asiago, Camembert, Cheshire, Gouda (aged), Emmental, Gruyère
Altbier.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Smoked sausage, pork and grilled salmon

American_Double.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Beef dishes, grilled meats, barbecue and grilled salmon

English_IPA.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Curry dishes, shellfish, light fish dishes and fried foods

American_Pale_Ale.Glassware: Pint or nonic, tumbler, beer mug

American_IPA.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Blackened chicken, spicy dishes and shellfish

Aroma-and-taste.Malts: Range includes sweet, caramel, chocolaty, toffee, toasty, nutty, coffee, roasty and dark fruits
Aroma-and-taste.Hops: Mild, although American examples may contain citrus character
Aroma-and-taste.Yeast: Generally neutral, though soft fruity esters may be present

American_Brown_Ale.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Beef stew, grilled and roasted meats, pork, sausage, and barbecue

Appearance.Head: Creamy, often long-lasting, leaving a lace on the glass

Aroma-and-taste.Malts: Caramel-sweet, chocolaty, toffee, coffee, toasty, roasty or burnt
Aroma-and-taste.Hops: Supportive bitterness in Irish and English styles; aromatic and bold in American styles
Aroma-and-taste.Yeast: Estery notes of various dark fruits, including plum and fig

Mouth-feel.Finish: Long to everlasting, dry to wet

Russian_Imperial_Stout.Taste_Smell: Balanced, Rich, Malty, Dark Fruit, Full-bodied

Appearance.Head: Fluffy, long-lasting, leaving a lace on the glass

Aroma-and-taste.Malts: Sweet and biscuity to chocolaty and toasty in dark styles
Aroma-and-taste.Hops: Very mild, however can be discernable in some popular styles
Aroma-and-taste.Yeast: Fruity, estery notes of various light and dark tree fruits, including banana spicy, with flavor compounds that include clove in some styles

Mouth-feel.Carbonation: Round and can be spritzy, but very delicate in specific styles

Appearance.Head: Off-white to tan and generally lasting

Aroma-and-taste.Malts: Include caramel, chocolaty, toffee, toasty, nutty, coffee, dark fruit and mild to assertive roasty character
Aroma-and-taste.Hops: Generally mild, although some American examples can be more assertive
Aroma-and-taste.Yeast: Generally neutral, though moderate fruity esters may be present

Mouth-feel.Consistency: Smooth, while more roasty versions may have some astringency
Mouth-feel.Carbonation: Ranges across examples from delicate to spritzy

English_Porter.Popular_Examples: Samuel Smith’s Taddy Porter, Fuller’s London Porter, St Peter’s Old Style Porter, Meantime London Porter, Salopian Entire Butt English Porter, Ridgeway Santa’s Butt, Left Hand Black Jack Porter, St George Porter
English_Porter.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: Asiago, Brie, Colby, Emmental, Gloucester, Gouda (aged), Gruyère
English_Porter.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Roasted, smoked and barbecued foods, including beef, poultry, seafood, sausage, chili and hearty stews. Try with cheesecake for dessert

American_Porter.Popular_Examples: Anchor Porter, Sierra Nevada Porter, Smuttynose Robust Porter, Rogue Mocha Porter, Deschutes Black Butte Porter, Great Lakes Edmund Fitzgerald Porter, Knee Deep Tanilla Porter, Flying Dog Road Dog Porter, Scuttlebutt Porter, Stone Smoked Porter, Alaskan Smoked Porter, Kona Pipeline Porter, Breckenridge Vanilla Porter, Avery New World Porter, Thomas Hooker Imperial Porter
American_Porter.Cheese_Pairing_Ideas: Asiago, Brie, Colby, Gloucester. Emmental, Gouda (aged), Gruyère with milder American Porters
American_Porter.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Roasted, smoked and barbecued foods, including beef, poultry, seafood, sausage, chili and hearty stews. Try with cheesecake for dessert

Baltic_Porter.Taste_Smell: Malty, Cocoa, Coffee, Alcohol, Medium- Full- bodied
Baltic_Porter.Popular_Examples: Baltika #6 Porter, BOSS Browar Black Boss Porter, Okocim Porter, Sinebrychoff Porter, Zywiec Porter, Flying Dog Gonzo Imperial Porter, Ska Nefarious Ten Pin, Victory Baltic Thunder
Baltic_Porter.Food_Pairing_Ideas: Roasted, smoked and barbecued foods, including beef, poultry, seafood, sausage, chili and also hearty stews
